A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
How to say to a nice and guy and a decent filmaker that he just smashed me in the face? and not in a good way ..  unfortunatly\, that is what just happened with Rian Johnson and the last jedi.
I liked a decent part of the film\, but what I didn't like was enough to make me think "I'm done"!
the treatment of  the "core" of the star wars saga\, the heart of it\, his essence\, I mean Luke Skywalker" felt bad..
Speaking with images\, it was as if in the middle of a " heart transplantation" someone just shot a bullet in it.:  pretty sure it is not a good moove.
No I do not think that the burnt hearth policy is a great one\, a cool one\, an "ok "one.
yes stories and people must evolve\, and finaly fade away. that's life\, that's natural. but to do it in a agressive way\, like it has been done here\, reminded me strongly of  the recent destruction of the city of Palmyra\, or of Bamiyan Buddha . (Yes\, that was That way of doing it \, and How it felt watching it..)
The same ideas could have been said\, the same goal achieves in a more respectful way for the long time star wars lovers\, and without the "finger in the face" of the "and all this wasn't even real"
 Rather than destruction\, I would always prefere evolution.
